intro: Macrocroton cuneatus, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod-like fruits and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, while the leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
